Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: glopeterson
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 4 nights. It was a great location. I went walking in the mornings down the boulevard in front of the hotel and felt very safe. It's convenient to a number of restaurants and the steak house at the hotel was terrific. The staff was very helpful and the concierge quickly learned our group's schedule and made sure to have car service arranged for us in the morning. The breakfast buffet was excellent. There is a convenience store less than a block away where you can buy bottled water and snacks for a lot less than at the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. The only downside was that the WiFi was fairly expensive, but it did have some lower use daily options. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So so for a Marriott -NO WIFI IN THE ROOMS - For business travelers it s an inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: xaviercap
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, staff are nice , must plug my laptop to the network cable and be charged for 20 dollars per day !!! Otherwise the rooms are nice and clean. Check your breakfast bill , you must sign it ! One day they charged 8 dollars then the next morning for the same bkfst 15 dollars ... They tell you they have wifi in the lobby and restaurant , never can access it ! Elevators pretty slow or in maintenance...

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Braziliancritic
Reviews.Content: Pros Good rooms space Good restaurants Good breakfast Cons No free wifi If you pay for the wifi connection you can't use it in your room, just at the lobby Elevators not working properly, everyday one was out of service, one day all elevators weren't working Waiter pushing you to sign the bill at breakfast

Reviews.Title: “A place where things are taken for granted...”
Reviews.Author: earroyave
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters to the American businessmen and embassy staff due to its location. The hotel leaves a lot to be desired when compared to other hotels that are in the area. I tried this property out because of the points program but have decided that it is not worth it. Had several incidents where complaints were filed with the hotell staff and nothing was addressed the first time around. The hotel is basically a "cave" not having any windows and therefore feels dark and cold. Located next to the alternative lifestyle quarter (Zona Rosa has changed in nature over the last several years) it offers the visitor either weird entertainment or disgusting sights depending on the visitor's tolerance levels. There are definitely better options available for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “So, so hotel, OK for a business trip.”
Reviews.Author: asorpresas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one night during business trip. The room is small but has good ammenities. Internet connection is decent, expect 1-2Mbps. One thing I did found was the long lines to check in and check out. Took me 20 minutes waiting to be checked in. I also saw a couple of guests complaining on some charges. I did not had any problems. Bed was too soft for me, no pillow options. Is a good hotel for business right in Reforma, but the location can also be a problem. All manifestants usually use Reforma street. Rooms in the right side of the building do not have a view at all, they face towards a building onlu about 60 ft from you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value hotel at Reforma”
Reviews.Author: jmolina11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with Marriot rewards points. The location is excellent. It is one block away from the angel and one block away from the 222 shopping mall where you have places to eat, shop and a movie theater. The hotel facilities are great. Furniture looks new. Rooms are Marriott standard nice to spend the night with comfortable bed and pillows. Restaurant is very nice. Sunday brunch is quite good also. I share the opinion on the wifi internet price. We just used the iphone connection and also we used the business center for a quick connection once. However, the experience was positive in balance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Reforma Avenue near "El Angel"”
Reviews.Author: Clatar1977
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel location in the heart of Reforma Avenue. It is very close to Reforma 222 commercial center, and "El Angel" place. Rooms are simple decorating but B&W pictures with black marks give a distinctive look. Everything is new at the hotel: carpets, furniture and, as usual at Marriot, bed and pillows are gorgeous! Sunday brunch buffet is quite various.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Skatexplorer
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a good example of the Marriott chain. The rooms were clean, well maintained and comfortable. Breakfast was superb - a very wide buffet selection including the global norms as well as some local additions. The concierge staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. The gym was well equipped (for a hotel gym) but as usual, lacked free weights at the lower end of the scale. The pool wasn't quite as expected, being in a confined space and in the shade for most of the day. Location was good for exploring Mexico City. The Historic Centre is a short hop away by taxi (or a pleasant walk), as is the excellent Anthropology Museum. Zona Rosa and Condesa are also within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with good executive lounge”
Reviews.Author: Bolleaux
Reviews.Content: Mr. Bolleaux stayed here for 2 nights. Very efficient check-in for elites, I was met in the lobby by one of the concierge staff who had a list of elites, and spirited to my room, that was it. No lines, no check-in desk, perfect. Room was very nice, the city center location is great with lots of restaurants and some stores loacted a block away from the hotel. Very nice top floor executive lounge, the really nice part was an open air terrace very nicely laid out and with great views over Mexico City. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need (except free Wi-fi)”
Reviews.Author: Cat_9079
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with comfortable, fresh rooms. Excellent gym, variety of restaurants. Location is wonderful with the tree-lined park outside the front door and plenty more dining and entertainment options just around the back of the property. Staff was very warm and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: traveler2710
Reviews.Content: Great service, great spa and gym, excellent food at la mansion restaurant, personnel very helpful it was a great stay

Reviews.Title: “The best treatment in years”
Reviews.Author: sicomorotree
Reviews.Content: I had nothing bad to say about this hotel and its employees. Since the moment I arrived all of them made my stay incredible. I travel every other week around the world and this was my first time in Mexico. I can tell you that this is the hotel to be. The concierge arranged a chauffeur services for the entire week, the lunch buffet was great, the Spa treatments out of this world and the room service outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Sorry I Didn't Listen To Other Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: dealm8ker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here because it was only 15,000 Mariott points per night. Now I know why. I had read the previous reviews. . .but I thought "It's a Mariott, it can't be that bad." Actually, the facility is very nice. The lobby and restaurants are beautiful, the gym is excellent and the room was well appointed. But HELLO! IS ANYBODY AT MARIOTT HEADQUARTERS LISTENING? I am not the first person to complain about the following issues. (Scroll down) They apparently don't care. There is no Wifi in the room. There is a Eathernet Cable. But Internet is 250 pesos per day. That's about $21.00! Outrageous! I called Customer Service to complain about the price. They said someone would call me back. I never received a call. There were no wine glasses in our room the second day. I again called Customer Service. After 45 minutes I headed down to the Front Desk to talk to the Manager on Duty. The young lady at the front desk told me that the Manager on Duty was "In his room". She said he would be down in 5 minutes. The Manager on duty (Jaime Gonzalez) finally showed up after about 15 minutes. He said he would send wine glasses to my room, but that he would have to check with another Manager (Daniel Sanchez) to see if there was anything they could do about the price of the Internet. He said that i should return to my room and he would call me in 5 minutes. He called 10 minutes later and said that they could offer me 6 hours of Internet at 1/2 price. I explained that I needed 24-hour service and he finally agreed to 24 hours at 1/2 Wow. . .how rigid? HELLO MARIOTT. . .this Hotel needs to do something different with the Internet. Just one more comment. Yes, the Hot Tub is luke warm and its outside. I'm not the first one to say this. IS ANYONE LISTENING? They must just not care. And one recommendation: Ask for a room that is not on the East side of the building if you are staying on a Friday or Saturday night. There is a Club on that side that blairs "pounding" music until 5am. Thank you Trip Advisor, I will always listen from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Not the level of customer service you'd expect from a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: curlytb
Reviews.Content: So this hotel is still a Marriott- Nice decor, great gym, good bar and executive lounge- but the lack of customer service, rigidity and other irritations all added up to make this a less than satisfying stay. My colleagues and I encountered several problems trying to secure a government rate. I spent the better part of a day presenting ID's, explaining my situation, and requesting corroborating emails to obtain special rates. The kicker is that my colleague booked online and was able to get the special rate without presenting any ID or any corroborating documents. Also, I was told that internet access was included in my special rate, which it wasn't. Other issues- the elevators are key activated, so you can only get off on your floor, the lobby, or the exectuvie lounge. Thre major problem was that the key reader didn't work, so I'd spend several cycles going up and down on the elevator trying to get it to read my key so I could get back to my room! I saw several other guests having the same problem. In the bar, we were having a casual meet and greet with local colleagues, but the live music was extremely loud (even though it was a jazz duo). We asked if they could turn the music down, which they did, but when the duo came back from their break, they turned the music back up! When we asked again, the waitress told us we could go to the other side of the lobby away from the music. So we left the bar, and we saw most of the bar patrons follow suit. Seems to me that if several bar patrons are requesting softer music, you would turn the music down, no? They were extremely rigid at the executive lounge- you couldn't take any food or drink back to your room, and they asked repeatedly for our room numbers. You have to pay for internet access, and it is limited to one device per room. Not one device at a time, but one device period. That means you would need to pay for two codes if you wanted to use an iphone/bb and computer, even if not at the same time. Talk about nickle and diming... And finally, the sister of a colleague called repeatedly and was told that my colleague had not yet checked in, even though she had arrived and was the one that had made the reservations for our whole group. All in all, small agravations are amplified on a business trip, and completely overshadowed what is otherwise a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: Memphis12
Reviews.Content: First off, this is possibly the only Marriott in Latin America without wifi in the rooms. Not sure I understand why it is not offered. When I checked in there was no ethernet cable in the room, I had to call the front desk to get them to deliver one. Second, the drain in the bathroom between the toilet and the tub emits a weird odor (room 1221). Third, I have yet to figure out why this Marriott insists on you signing a "bill" in the executive lounge that has a zero balance. Not sure there are any other Marriott's that require this, it is possibly a ploy to get tips. I now have to travel to Mexico City on a regular basis and am quite loyal to Marriott, but this hotel just is not up to the standards of other Marriott properties.

Reviews.Title: “Central and safe”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravelerMVCA
Reviews.Content: This refurbished Marriott has a great central location in a very active neighborhood. They also have a great concierge level with spectacular views and an outside deck. The gym was quite good as was the shower and pool facility next to it. One complaint would be that the two Jacuzziâ€™s were only lukewarm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the most part”
Reviews.Author: dontez1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Reforma in Mexico City, June 23-27 2011. I am a Gold Rewards Member, and I was ushered to the Executive level to check in as soon as I gave my name. The room was comfortable. Beds nice and soft, slept well. The showers were wonderful, plenty of pressure and hot water. I was given two free bottles of water daily which is standard with the room. They provide food if you have Executive Lounge access from 6AM-10PM. Breakfast had a nice selection of cereals, fruits, breads...the only thing I didn't care for was the room temperature juice...They served mini sandwiches throughout the day which were great. They provided dinner later in the day, usually some local Mexican fare which was pretty good. The servers took the time to learn your name and what drinks you normally drink. I tried the buffet they had downstairs on Sunday. It was excellent. I tried the corn quesadilla and all it had in it was peppers and cheese, it was delish. They had pulled pork and shredded beef which was tender, juicy, and seasoned...No sauce was required. My only issue was when I had a friend come up to the room late one evening with me before heading to the clubs, security stopped us when getting on the elevator..and addressed my guest in Spanish like I wasn't standing there. I don't speak fluent Spanish and that was rude. I advised the front desk that is unacceptable. If you have an issue with my guest, you address me and not my guest. She was like for security issues, they needed the ID. Which is no big deal, I get that..but told her it's all about their presentation. But other than that little scene, the stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and resturants”
Reviews.Author: dustrod
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great service, rooms and food. The staff are nice and speak excellent english. The steak house is tops and the exective lounge is on the the best of Marriott. I only stay in this hotel in Mexico City

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service ever at a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: dzlee02
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I both hold Platinum status at Marriott, and this was hands-down the worst customer service we had ever experienced at this chain of hotels. We had a terrible time negotiating with the hotel management after we experienced some troubles with our room. On the first night, we discovered that the bathtub wouldnâ€™t drain and although this was inconvenient, we could and did live with it. However, we did immediately notify the management so that they could have someone look into fixing the problem. On the next day, we discovered that the hotel door didnâ€™t lock properly! Considering that we were both unfamiliar with Mexico City, we were extremely concerned about the security issues of sleeping without a proper lock and the fact that we had been leaving all of our possessions (including passports) in the room. It took upwards of an hour to get the hotel managerâ€™s attention, and finally, my boyfriend had to run down to reception to find him in person. The manager, Benjamin, came up to demonstrate that the door had to be shut forcefully a certain way in order for the lock to automate. This meant that the door, while it looked closed, had actually been unlocked the entire time. At this point, my boyfriend felt disgruntled enough to want to check out of the Marriott and into the Sheraton across the street. However, I was a Marriott loyalist, and convinced him that we should just switch rooms instead. It took two calls and an hour wait to get a new room. As an aside, the hotel staffâ€™s English is very poor, and this led to various misunderstandings about wanting to switch rooms. The new room had a perfectly functioning door that didnâ€™t require extra force / finagling. Upon checkout, we politely asked for additional bonus points to compensate for the inconvenience of having had to deal first with this many problems with a room, the insensitively long wait times, and then the actual room switch. This is a reasonable request by two Platinum members, but we were told that the arrival gift was sufficient and that we already had gotten a new room. By all accounts, a new room is the least that a hotel should offer to hotel guests of any level when there is a potential security issue. We found the hotelâ€™s response times to our various problems for the duration of our stay to be unacceptable, and the hotel manager, Benjamin, was completely unresponsive to our last request of compensation in the form of points. The rest of the stay was fine, but the beginning frustration and shock of the malfunctioning lock and the ensuing stonewalling from hotel management is not worth anyoneâ€™s time. Do NOT stay at this hotel - the Sheraton Isabel is across the street if you want to stay in the Reforma area / visit the Centro / etc. and the W is in the very upscale Polanco neighborhood with great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of currency exchange markup”
Reviews.Author: Rick_from_Dallas
Reviews.Content: Beware of currency exchange markup... negotiate a set price in USD and the hotel immediately marked-up the rate to an exchange rate of 13.5 Peso/USD which increased my daily rate by 12% (exchange rate was < 12.25 Peso/USD)... rooms are okay, nothing fabulous. Hotel is in a nice part of town but the traffic is terrible and getting anywhere by cab can be frustrating. Beware of the staff looking for tips when really do not deserve a tip... for example, the staff in the lounge on 16 (which is nice) do nothing but expect you to sign a bill and leave a tip. Fair hotel for the Marriott chain but nothing to rave about; staying here in that a favor Marriotts over other chains P.S. it should be noted that the water from the tap is certified to be up to the same standards as that in the USA

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Good service. Good location"”
Reviews.Author: Lalo64
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently for 2 nights. I found it excelent. Clean, good service. Great atmosphere and one plus: de excutive floor option in which you pay $40 extra dollars ang get all three meals in a buffet on the 16th floor. Very practical for businessmen.

Reviews.Title: “I'm planning my next trip now...”
Reviews.Author: Lakeside31
Reviews.Content: Took a last minute trip to Mexico, DF. The Reforma Marriott was a great choice- central location and wonderful service. It's very easy to get the Turibus nearby, and there are several restaurants, ATMs and a mall within 2 blocks. The restaurant in the hotel had tasty food and reasonable prices, but watch out for the lobby bar- drink prices can be high ($16 martini, anyone?). The neighborhood right behind the hotel is the gay district and there are many walkable streets. I felt safe the entire time I was in Mexico, and I used the common sense that I use in any large city. The taxi ride to the hotel from the airport was 250 pesos, less than $25 USD. Change a few dollars before you arrive at the airport to pay for the taxi, and then use the ATMs all over the city for cash.

Reviews.Title: “Good but....”
Reviews.Author: ImATravelinFool
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice on business trips to the DF. The hotel is beautiful and clean. The restaurants are good and the hotel is convenient to everything. The staff was polite. My only complaint, and it's a big one, is that I did not have hot water during either trip, each of which was a week long. Not good for shaving and showering in the morning. Each time I was there was a month or two apart and I stayed in a different room each time. Not sure what the dilemma was either time and my complaints seemed to do no good.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience at all...”
Reviews.Author: SW4Girl
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here for a business trip as my boss is a Marriott rewards member and we needed a hotel with meeting room facilities. I arrived before him and had pre-arranged a taxi to pick me up from the airport .and charge to my room. I was quoted a price by the hotel - and when I arrived, the cab driver tried to over charge my be MX$300! I queried with the hotel and they sorted it - but it seemed to go downhill from there on in. My room was on the side facing another building and was very dark - even at midday - so I had to have my room lights on all the time. I tried to move rooms but the hotel was full. When my boss did get there, we had a drink in the bar - which was really loud due to a live act. We were ignored by the staff and I had to go over and get someone to take our order. When we paid the bill. as we walked away a waitress (who hadn't even served us) ran after us saying we'd forgotten something. Not realising what it was we'd left behind - she then informed us we had forgotten to TIP and proceeded to thrust the bill back at us until my boss added a tip and signed it again! Flabbergasted to say the least. We were constantly made to feel like we had to leave a tip to anyone who dealt with us. The Concierge were generally very good and apologised for the taxi incident, and for the waitress but other than that I would not stay there again. I arranged a taxi with the hotel to take me to buy souvenirs - we agreed a price of MX$300 for an hour. We went and came back within the hour - guess what - the cab driver tried to over charge me! Definitely one hotel I will NOT be going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great New YearÂ´s Eve Party”
Reviews.Author: gigiomadrazo
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel on New YearÂ´s Eve. The party was great, the staff wonderful. Excellent customer service. We live in Mexico city but we paid a package that included one night stay and really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: AmerHasan
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised at the negative reviews. Just came back from two nights at the Marriott Reforma. I couldn't have imagined a better stay. Checkin was easy. as a Marriott Elite member got upgraded to use of the executive lounge - which was incredible. Free Breakfast, and evening cocktails and canapes. Great views from the 16th floor. Location was awesome. Right on a beautifully tree-lined major boulevard, you are in walking distance to many bars and restaurants. watched the Champions League final match at Boomers - a sports bar that was packed with Chicahrito fans. The paseo de reforma right outside the hotel's front entrance had an outdoor world festival going on. 68 countries or so had set up tents and were hawking food and souvenirs from their respective countries. The beds were extremely comfortable. maybe too comfortable. Was exhausted from walking all day - decided to take a quick nap around 8:00pm before going out and checking out the nightlife. Stayed asleep til 7am!. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful - most were bilingual. Really enjoyed it. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wont come back”
Reviews.Author: Ivan976
Reviews.Content: It might be naÃ¯ve, or a simplicity but the serviceâ€¦ it is just not what i expected from a 5 star Business hotel. For working reasons I had to wake very early this morning after a very long flight and working day the day before. I had some time in the afternoon so I decided to get a quick nap in lunchtime since the Hotel is really closed to my office. I ordered some food, and I signed the bill. After having lunch and while I was having my really needed nap, the waiter knock on my door, woke me up with the message that there was no credit on my account and that I had to pay in cash. I admit it, I was pissed off. I wanted a nap and I couldnâ€™t get it. Since I wouldnâ€™t be able to get it, I went to the lobby to clear the problem and to check what happened to the credit I gave the day before. I just wanted to get an apology and some explanation. Since I was returning to the hotel 2 days after, I said that I wanted to cancel the reservation, even without meaning it. I work in the industry and I was amazed that I went out of the lobby without an explanation, an apology and having cancelled my reservation. I couldnâ€™t believe how the hotel could lose a customer so easily. I felt so â€œnothingâ€� that I preferred to look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Safe Comfortable Modern Business Oriented Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuchoPacho
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel in the Zona Rosa. Very much like a hotel in USA. Very modern and well appointed public spaces. Top notch security including safe in room and card operated elevators. Always 3-4 guards/bellman on duty. Live music singer/combo in lobby lounge. Great bathrooms, very comfortable bed, lots of computer hookups, nice flatscreen TV with many channels. I booked the room in US dollars and got the bill in Pesos which was somewhat higher but I will wait for my credit card statement to get the final amount and take it up then.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING to USD rate bookings â€“ This hotel inflates MXN â€“ USD exchange rates”
Reviews.Author: mmppwwzz
Reviews.Content: A review of the hotel will follow this WARNING: This hotel inflates the exchange rate on bookings made in USD which increases the cost of the nightly rate you will pay. This exchange rate inflation is not disclosed on Marriott.com and the estimated cost provided by Marriott.com understates the amount you will pay. Even more disgracefully, this practice is not disclosed on check-in. And what a shame since the hotel itself is rather nice. The front desk clerk told me Mexican hotels are legally able to inflate their exchange rates by up to 8%. Be sure to take this into account when comparing the Marriott Reforma against other options. Apart from the above, this hotel is rather lovely. Itâ€™s well located near the Independence Angel which means itâ€™s roughly halfway between the downtown Zocalo area and the Bosque de Chapultapec / Polanco area. The room is standard Marriott fare; comfortable and well appointed. Maid service was spotless and prompt. I did find the wireless signal to be very weak in the room, but thereâ€™s a strong signal in the lobby and the executive lounge. The standout feature is the executive lounge which has a spectacular outdoor balcony overlooking Paseo de la Reforma. The staff annoyingly require a signature even on a zero dollar invoice which smacks of fishing for tips, but apart from that the staff are very helpful and friendly and the food and drink options are very good. Overall a lovely hotel, but the experience was marred by the hotelâ€™s distasteful practice of inflating the exchange rate which is really a cash grab designed to make you pay more than anticipated for the room. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jairoabq
Reviews.Content: I spent the week of 4/11/11 through 4/15/11 in the Marriott La reforma in mexico city. The good: The hotel was very well appointed and the service was very good all around. Every night the hotel had live music from 8pm to midnight by the bar. The musicians were fantastic. The food was very good as well. The excersise room was very nice, with plenty of space and had brand new equipment all around. There is also a lap swimming pool. The area around the spa and excersise room was very nicely done. The not-so-good: I could not sleep very well mainly because of the elevation of the city, but also because of the street noise. Also, this hotel is a bit pricey. wifi is only available in the lobby and it is not free and you have to pay per device. This means that if you want to connect your iphone and your laptop to the wifi signal you have to pay two separate fees. I thought this was rather greedy. Food, although fairly good, is pricey as well. Also, they even charge for local phone calls. Finally, they did not honor my requests: I asked for a king-size bed, got two doubles instead. Asked for a high floor, got a lower floor instead. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again if I were going back to mexico city on business mainly because of the good service, nice decor and location.

Reviews.Title: “â€œThe hotel is overbooked and there is nothing we can do to help youâ€� Marriott Reforma Manager”
Reviews.Author: FA-Dallas
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Marriott Reforma hotel with my wife and 4-year old son at around 10PM. I identified myself as a Marriott Rewards Platinum member and presented my identification and confirmed reservation number. The front desk employees proceeded to let me know that they didnâ€™t have any reservations under my name. After a few minutes, another employee showed up to say that my confirmation number did show up in the system, but that â€œI or my travel companyâ€� had canceled the reservation and that there were no rooms available. I tried to explain that I had no reason to cancel my reservation specially when traveling with my family to a dangerous city, but the manager proceeded to confirm â€œThe hotel is overbooked and there is nothing we can do to help youâ€�. My family and I had to go find a new hotel at 11:30PM. I have traveled all over the world for 14+ years and I have never encountered a situation quite like this. Its frustrating to know that being a Marriott Rewards Platinum member with a confirmed reservation doesnâ€™t make a difference at this hotel. There are many professionally managed hotels in the Reforma area, don't take the risk!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Very Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: mwillatl
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with the positive, becuase the Marriott Reforma is a beautiful hotel with well appointed rooms, a fantastic rooftop executive terrace, and generally friendly staff. Having said that, the management leaves a bitter taste in my mouth, and for that reason I am unable to recomment it. Upon check-in, I was told that because there were a total of 3 people staying in my room, I would be forced to pay a $45 USD surcharge per night. I originally booked my room using Marriott Rewards points (I am a Gold member), and was assured by Marriott that there would be no additional charges. The front desk, however, saw that there were 3 people on my reservation, and told me they had no choice but to charge the extra (and previously unmentioned) surcharge. I attempted to explain my situation, not only to the front desk worker, but also to her manager. They remained courteous, but were completely unresponsive, offering only "This is a franchise, we charge this fee, and there is no way we will take it off, even though it was not part of your original booking." They couldn't even get Marriott corporate on the phone. I will be in touch with Marriott USA, and will be fighting this extra charge, but it will be a hassle and a blemish on an otherwise great stay. Frankly, management should be embarrassed. I love Mexico City, and understand that when visiting a developing country western standards of hospitality and customer service aren't always adhered to. I had, though, expected such standards from Mariott. I was apparently, and unfortunately, mistaken.

Reviews.Title: “Consider another property for better service”
Reviews.Author: cocytien
Reviews.Content: Management will disrespect your local guests and embarrass you should you wish to have them enter the hotel after 8pm. Although I am a Marriott Rewards Platinum Premier member, this hotel's management saw fit to mistreat my local guests on several evenings. Even an additional registered guest was denied a toiletry item (razor) that would be standard issue upon request at any other Marriott or hotel. Furthermore, after five consecutive days, one would think that they front desk staff would recognize their guests, though this wasn't the case. A 3rd visitor was denied entry unless a $45US supplemental fee was paid. There was clearly an attempt to drain more cash for the property at the expense of a descent experience of one of Marriott's best customers. I've never encountered such rules and additional fees, and disrespect of Marriott Rewards members and their guests at any other property with which the Marriott name is affiliated. Worse yet, the hotel General Manager couldn't see the benefit of a satisfied customer on his last night at the property. With a 4:30AM checkout to the airport, I was too exhausted to argue the many reasons why it would have been better to accommodate a consistently valuable and loyal Marriott Rewards member and guest at their property,

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to executive lounge for terrific service”
Reviews.Author: Travelover02
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in nearly perfect location. We upgraded to executive lounge access and it was worth every penny. The breakfast was very good with excellent coffee. The late afternoon tea morphs into cocktail hour with a great spread of food that easily becomes dinner. Highly recommended. The only downside is the extra cost of wireless internet in the room (which costs close to US$25 per day). The easy alternative is to use the business centre which has free internet and is open 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: boulderave
Reviews.Content: I almost never bother to review Marriott hotels. This family of hotels has always been way better than average. However, we just finished a four night stay at the Marriott Reforma and this hotel exceed our expectations in every way. The hotel, the staff and the restaurant were all excellent. The location is about half way between the Centro Historico and Chapultepec. The bus service along Reforma was good and you're just a three or four short blocks away from the Insurgentes metro. It was a great stay for my family.

Reviews.Title: “NOT recommended, but if you must stay here...make sure your door locks!”
Reviews.Author: bizzytravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of hotels- I'm platinum Marriott and gold Hilton. This is definitely one of those trying to be an upscale hotel, but failing miserably. There are a few people here that are interested in customer service, but the majority are not. Even if you ignored the attitudes of some and focused on the hotel itself there a problems and no one wants to address them. The first problem I had was my door didn't lock when the door was closed the majority of the time.....I would come back to the room, check the door and it was unlocked, especially after housekeeping service.. I called about it...they sent a guy up...who stuck a key card in the door and declared it fixed. Not so much!! In summary, after several calls and being told: to stick the card in the door several times until I hear it click....pull the door closed and place my card in the door several times until I hear a click, .and it's "normal" for the doors not to lock and they have the problem "all the time" I was finally moved to a room where the door actually locks. I had five people at my door before it was determined that the door was actually not working and they would need to move me because the guy sticking a screwdriver in the doorway wasn't really accomplishing anything. The voice mail service in this room is broken, and instead of fixing it, they turn the "message waiting" light on in my room when they have a message or want me to make a weekly payment. The last time, they wouldn't/couldn't turn the red flashing light off. They told me to call a number which I did and it still wouldn't turn off. I finally unplugged the phone and the next day they had to send someone up to turn the light off...not to fix the voice mail. Ridiculous! A few days ago the showers had no water when I called after a few hours to ask if they knew when there would be water again. I was told they would call when the water was available. They never called. Fortunately the water did become available hours later, and I knew to check it, not to rely on anyone here. Today I had 3 men come to my door and tell me they needed to check the electricity in the room and it would take one minute. They came in, turned off the t.v.turned off the internet access to my computer which I was using, moved all of the furniture around, took panels off the wall and began talking on their walkie talkies after a few minutes I asked how much longer they would be and they told me a few more minutes....NOT the one minute they had originally said at the door. I told them they had said one minute, it had been several, and I had things to do and they didn't really seem concerned. When I called to the front desk to speak to a manager I was told I didn't need to speak to a manager that maintenance was allowed in my room anytime. After further conversation and being placed on hold I was told the manager was in a "very important business meeting" and would call me in 30 minutes.....hours later guess who I never heard from!!!!! The fitness center is very nice, and they always have fresh towels on the equipment, but they don't clean the equipment, if someone leaves garbage in the cup holders, it's going to be there the next day and a few days later. The saunas and steam room have been unavailable for awhile, but that's due to a fire that was reportedly caused by a male guest that left the sauna on, so that is our of their control. I noticed that the most recent reviews of this hotel are poor and there is a reason for that...their customer service needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: “No in room wireless Internet.....”
Reviews.Author: SwampChicken
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Nice restaurants as well. They only thing that was irritating was no in room wireless Internet. How can a Marriott now have in room wireless. Had to go down to the lobby every time I wanted to connect. Other than that... Everything you could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Schackel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 5 nights at Marriott Reforma Hotel in October 2010. I was very happy with the choice and can recommend this hotel to everybody. The staff was very serviceable, they helped me with a lot of things. My room was well-sized and absolutely clean. The furniture was perfect, nothing was missing, and the decoration was typical for an international hotel, inconspicuously and a bit charmless. The bathroom was well-sized, too, with a nice, big shower and some useful accessories. The bathroom was perfectly clean. The most remarkable thing was the absolute absence of any noise. My room was located on floor 12, so traffic wasn't an issue. Furthermore, the glazing and isolation was very good. I didn't hear anything from the floor or the neighbouring rooms. My bed was super comfortable and I therefore slept like an angel. I didn't have breakfast in the hotel, nor did I use the bar or the restaurant. The location is very nice, too, in the middle of Zona Rosa. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and clubs, offering something for everybody's taste. The region is rather safe, although you have to take care at night. Chapultepec Parc, with its museums and attractions, is just a 15 minute walk away. Overall, I was very satisfied with the hotel. There are just a few negative things to mention: - no coffee machine on the room - Wireless Internet costs 20 US$ per day, which is ridiculous - Drinks from the minibar are ridicously expensive If the internet access would have been free of charge, I would have given 5 stars. By the way, if you're coming with your family and you don't necessarily need nightlife, better find something in Polanco, north of the Chapultepec Parc. This neighboorhood is safer, more fancy and offers plenty of nice restaurants, high-class shops and nice shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: Feyenoorder
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the zona rosa on Reforma and is in one of the safer areas of a very dangerous city. The lobby is modern and attractive and has a great lobby bar with excellent entertainment at night. Staff are helpful and friendly and all speak English very well. The rooms are very well appointed, the beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are very modern and clean. The steak restaurant Le Maison is reasonable and high quality, the room service menu is good. Breakfast is average. I stay here for every trip now in Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Regular Guest”
Reviews.Author: travis8781
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to this hotel fairly regularly for the last couple of years, but I'm afraid I've stayed my last night at this Marriott hotel. The overall experience has deteriorated to the point that I can't stay here any longer. The staff have become increasingly unfriendly, rude, and even abusive on occasions. This coupled with the decline in the rooms which are now dirty and ill prepared have forced me to seek out alternatives (next time its the Hilton).

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: tribal2
Reviews.Content: I have made this my default hotel in MEX. Elite Benefits are great with Club Access and included Internet. Great location and many restaurant options Mansion, Angus, etc. The fitness center is one of the best. The massages are bit pricey but the facilities are awesome. Also the hotel taxis are very good I hired a driver for the day and felt very safe and with great information.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Reforma is a gem”
Reviews.Author: Markgdallas
Reviews.Content: Great location, service and styling. Fitness center is really top notch. Rooms are a little small but the finish out is pretty much what you'd see in a W or comparable luxury hotel. Try for an odd numbered room. The even numbered rooms face the wall of a taller office building going up next door. The odd numbered rooms have a better view of Reforma and the new Hyatt going up across the way. Pay extra for access to the concierge lounge on the roof for stunning views, bfest in the morning and drinks in the early evening before going out on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aru90015
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier with my stay in Mexico City. The service at the hotel is second-to-none. The rooms are very comfortable and the views from the Executive Lounge, located at the top of the hotel, are fantastic. I will definitely stay at the Marriott Reforma again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JDSV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mexico City Marriott Reforma Hotel for 7 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was luxurious and comfortable. The service was very friendly and the location very central. For the price difference we recommend booking a room in the executive floors: the executive lounge on the top floor offers breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks throughout the day at no cost! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Reforma Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KenF2
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel...great staff, great service and wonderful accomodations. I called down for a pot of coffee at 4:00am prior to leaving for the airport and room service was knocking on my door in less than 5 minutes!!!! Great hotel...the concierge floor is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service in a modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: sj134
Reviews.Content: We traveled at the beginning of the Christmas season and were given a corner room high above the Reforma and view of the giant Christmas Tree they set up on the circle below. The room was not big, but had a very nice view. Very clean and well stocked, plenty of hot water in the bathroom. No street noise or from neighboring rooms. The staff was very attentive and spoke perfect English. They arranged a tour to the Pyramids of the Sun and said we would be back by 2 p.m. The tour actually took until 5 p.m. and we were afraid we would miss our flight, luckily it was a Sunday and we made it to the airport quickly. The pool area is small and wedged between the Marriott and the neighboring building, the hot tubs were being repaired. The pool water was well heated and the retractable roof closed. The showers in the men's spa had no hot water. The gym is clean and nearly complete, only lacking abdominal equipment. The Reforma is the the main artery through Mexico City and the Zona Rosa is behind the hotel with many restaurants and clubs 24 hours a day. We felt safe walking the streets even at 3 a.m. You do not need a car, many attractions are accessable on foot or by taxi. The rooms are secure, you need a key for the elevator and the rooms provide a safe. Did not like the fact we could not bring friends up to the room for a half hour while we changed clothes. Internet is 50 pesos per hour.

Reviews.Title: “What a pity”
Reviews.Author: MissPf
Reviews.Content: I so wanted to write a good review on this hotel as on the surface it is a great place. I wouldn't agree with another reviewer who said the restaurants were not up to scratch as I thought they were excellent and so was the service. The rooms are good too but that would be because it's a relatively newly refurbished hotel. And I was very pleased with myself I had picked this place. That was until I really had a problem and suddenley, the service was non-exisitent. They damaged my shirt and lost a belt off a very expensive jacket. After speaking to five so called managers and several hours, I still hadn't got any response so eventually asked to speak to the General Manager. Suddenly after a whole day wasted making phone calls and waiting and waiting and waiting, just to find out what's going on, my shirt turned up mended and they 'found' the belt. After this I was eyed suspiciously by the staff and had a 2 hour nightmare getting the order I asked for from room service. I don't normally write a tome like this but I do hope the General Manager reads this. Had he bothered to call and apologise, I would of probably just mentioned what a great hotel this was but as he didn't seem in any way concerned about my issues...I shall leave it to you to decide. On the whole this is a good hotel ..but only on the surface. The warm welcome and happy smiles don't always mean a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic but not a great view”
Reviews.Author: pdajunkee
Reviews.Content: I would classify this as one of the best hotels I've stayed at if I didn't open the curtains to enjoy the view. The hotel is dwarfed by the huge building next door. But who sits and stares out the window when they are in Mexico City? Services was great, room was great, fitness room was fantastic! Try the chicken noodle soop in the restaurant on the main floor. Best I've ever had! Served with broth, chicken and rice and a side dish with diced onions, tomatoes, cilantro and peppers. You scoop in whatever you fancy into your soup and then enjoy. Fajitas were good as well. The steak restaurant was decent, steaks are served on a cast iron plate sizzling away.

Reviews.Title: “First Class hotel”
Reviews.Author: larmas
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, quite rooms. IPOD docking stations on alarm clock. 2 GREAT restaurants with first class service.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kmp22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on business. GREAT hotel--not one complaint. Super clean, perfect service, nice rooms, comfy bed, gorgeous facilities from lobby to gym to spa to Executive lounge. Would definitely stay again. Located in a great place too--plenty of restaurants around the corner (and in a safe area to walk) but room service wasnt bad either. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: UScene1701
Reviews.Content: For a brand new hotel the facilities are excellent but the tour operator they use for their trips is poor both in quailty of coaches and guides. Nice hotel as it is new but be aware that building work is taking place on both sides of the hotel. Executive room nice to have use of but is open season to local people after 8o'clock who get access to a service that guests pay extra for free Expensive internet facility but good value hotel considering its new features

Reviews.Title: “Brand new Marriott, Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: gators93
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in early March 2009. The hotel was opened 4 months prior, in December or November of 2008. It is brand new. All staff jumped at every request, from arrival to departure. A walk across the lobby earns quite a few "buenos dias", truely making me feel like a valued guest. I had a AAA rate and they are the only place that has ever asked me to present my id card upon checkin. I had a weekend rate that I thought was very reasonable, especially for a Marriott, and for the location. It is across the street from the US Embassy and borders the Zona Rosa. The subway is approximately 4 block walk away, something I felt was close. The hotel gym is very nicely equipped with 5 or 6 treadmills and a few other cardio pieces, free weights, machine weights, and quite a few other goodies. Individual tv's on most cardio machines. There is an outdoor pool. I did not use the business center. I ordered room service twice. Both times it was brought promptly by a friendly staff member. I thought the pricing was reasonable, if I remember correctly, it was $13 for a club sandwich and beer, including tax and tip. The room is nicely apportioned, exactly what you would expect from a Marriott. Perhaps the room is a bit small, but that is fine with me. If I had to complain, it would be the internet charge in the room is expensive at $18/day. I ended up going around the corner with my laptop to a starbucks where it is free. Also the hotel has a nice car service to take you where you need to go that is comfortable and well done. However, it is roughly twice that of other car services that you can call. Those would be my two cost issues I would mention. Overall this is a great property for a business visit. The staff could not have been more willing to please. I plan to be back in August.

Reviews.Title: “New, Good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: yellowrose13
Reviews.Content: This was an Aristos on the edge of the Zona Rosa when I lived in Mexico City in the 1990s. Marriott has done a great job of upgrading the facilities and making it a much better hotel. I chose it over the JW Marriott, the hotel I usually stay in. The rates were great, the services good. The only downside was the air conditioning that did not cool....ever....in the two nights and three days.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayne94
Reviews.Content: During my stay in Mexico City, I stayed at the Marriott Reforma and the JW Marriott. Both hotels were great! The Marriott Reforma is in the Zona Rosa area. It was recently remodelled and has been open one month so everything is nice and new. I did not have a room with a great view; there's construction going on, however, this was never ever an issue as the work didn't begin until maybe 9am and actually was not loud. I want to stress that I didn't find this an issue like in some places I've stayed in where construction is taking place. I stayed here during Christmas time and the hotel was very empty, but I would not hesitate to recommend staying here. This part is important - when taking a taxi, most drivers are not familiar yet with this property name. Just tell them it's located where the Hotel Aristos used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, Great Hotel... Still working out the kinks..”
Reviews.Author: tribal2
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights recently. Got a decent rate of $200/AAA. The hotel is fabulous. Everything is brand new very high tech as the previous poster indicated. The gym is fabulous, everything was brand new in the exercise room and they have a whole spa. The gym occupies almost a whole floor and I only used the machines but they had a small pool (outside and not heated) and a Jacuzzi. The hotel has only opened a few weeks ago (my guess is early December 2008). However some of the staff indicated it had not been inaugurated officially so it was some sort of soft opening. The staff is very helpful although they are still not completely up to speed and some things take a little while. For example I charged my taxi to the airport to the room and it took them almost 20 minutes to do my checkout. However staff is very helpful. They have their own La Mansion restaurant on premises with a great view of Reforma avenue. The building is only 12-15 stories high as it was an old hotel that was converted (Aristos). However I believe they gutted everything as it appeared brand new all around. Actually I suspect I may have been the first guest to occupy the room I as in 1209 as the TV wasn't wired properly. It would turn on but not change channels. I am technically inclined and checked the wiring and found out the hotel control box was connected to the AUX port instead of TV port and fixed this. This indicated to me that either I was the first guest in the room or they previous guests had not used the TV which is probably unlikely. Did room service a couple times and they were quite helpful. My MR points haven't posted in over a week so I suspect they may have issues with their systems due to being so new. Please PM me if you want additional tips.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: Biz_Traveller Latin America
Reviews.Content: An aside. I ended up here because I tried to book into the W in Mexico City and their booking service was so terrible I gave up! The new Marriott (open less than a week when I was there) has a stunning lobby, very enthusiastic staff and fairly small rooms. But don't be put off by the small rooms, they make incredible use of the available space and are probably the most technologically advanced of any hotel I've stayed in (i.e. put your ipod in the alarm clock docking port and it will wake you with your favourite tunes!). As such, you need to let the bellboy explain what everything does in the room, because you'll be amazed. This hotel is right by the Zona Rosa, so good for restaurants, bars etc, as well as being central (if such a thing exists in DF) for business. Bad luck W, I won't be trying to book with you again, but will definitely return to the new Marriott.
